case_vignette:
An infectious disease investigator is evaluating the diagnostic accuracy of a new interferon-gamma-based assay for diagnosing tuberculosis in patients who have previously received a Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine. Consenting participants with a history of BCG vaccination received an interferon-gamma assay and were subsequently evaluated for tuberculosis by sputum culture. Results of the study are summarized in the table below.
Tuberculosis, confirmed by culture No tuberculosis Total
Positive interferon-gamma assay 90 6 96
Negative interferon-gamma assay 10 194 204
Total 100 200 300
question: Based on these results, what is the sensitivity of the interferon-gamma-based assay for the diagnosis of tuberculosis in this study?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I don't have any symptoms; I'm just here as part of a study evaluating a new test for tuberculosis.
Have you been in contact with anyone known to have tuberculosis recently?
No, I haven't been in contact with anyone known to have tuberculosis recently.
Have you experienced a chronic cough, night sweats, weight loss, or fever recently?
No, I haven't experienced any of those symptoms recently.
Do you have any history of tuberculosis or a positive tuberculosis test in the past?
I don't have a history of tuberculosis, but I have been vaccinated with the BCG vaccine in the past.
Final Diagnosis: Latent Tuberculosis Infection (for study purpose evaluation, given BCG vaccination and no active symptoms or contact)
